intro: Ischaemum timorense, commonly known as Timor grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to the island of Timor and surrounding regions in Indonesia. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical climates, often in open grasslands or disturbed soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Ischaemum timorense is adapted to withstand drought and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
